message: check out the #rstats hashtag on TWITTER: http://twitter.com/search?q=%23rstats
more informal than StackOverflow, Q&A at QUORA: http://www.quora.com/R-software
ok, I'll start by adding http://www.r-bloggers.com which really is an aggregator of 160+ bloggers -- good example of the ensemble method in practice :-)
which R-blogs do you subscribe to, and why ??

here's an overhelming blog list by Peter Skomoroch which spills over to data mining: http://www.quora.com/What-are-the-best-blogs-about-data/answer/Peter-Skomoroch -- let's suppose you had to pick the top 3...
the trick to search for R info at STACKOVERFLOW is to use the tag [r], for example, see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/r?sort=votes&pagesize=50 for the highest votes.

critique of Sweave: http://pineda-krch.com/2010/12/01/top-10-things-that-suck-about-sweave/ -- automated creation of a PDF document containing not just text, but also tables and charts generated from R via LaTeX.

just created a BLEKKO search tag, see https://blekko.com/ws/+/rsvp/rstats+/view which can be used to refine searches on R topics. To keep up to date remotely, subscribe to the RSS link. If you are interesting in co-editing this slashtag, let me know via that link.
StackExchange has a R section on statistical analysis: http://stats.stackexchange.com/questions/tagged/r?sort=votes&pagesize=50
new group for R statistical computing http://identi.ca/group/rstats at IDENTI.CA (started by yours truly :-)
@rsvp Had a look at identi.ca, what with the whole Twitter developer thing, but can't say I like it.

@atomicules do you mean re: no new Twitter clients?  Usually an identi.ca group tag like !rstats gets translated to #rstats at Twitter when a status is forwarded, but now I am wondering if the API for forwarding identi.ca updates to Twitter is still operational. The whole dev ecosystem around Twitter has radically changed for sure.

@rsvp Yeah, that's what I meant. Not really thought of using Twitter for finding R info. I follow RStatz (https://twitter.com/#!/RStatz), but that's it. I'll have to keep an eye on the #rstats tag (and start using it myself).
Google group for R: http://groups.google.com/group/the-r-project-for-statistical-computing (they need to yank some spammers though)
daily R tips on Twitter: https://twitter.com/RLangTip
Twitter collection of resources for the R Open Source Statistics Community -- sponsored by Revolution Analytics: https://twitter.com/inside_R
